projects.title: Project 1: Dynamic Webpage
projects.description: This is a a small web application with HTML, CSS, and JavaScript that loads data from an external API and enables the viewing of data points in detail.
projects.stack: This app uses HTML, CSS, and JavaScript
role: Build the frontend interface displaying a list of Pokémon, when clicked upon the details of the selected Pokémon will appear in a popup.
Reading in the data from the API, parsing the info, and displaying the details of each Pokémon.
learnings: Load data from an external source (API)

images.alt: Pokedex Main Page showing list of clickable Pokemon

projects.title: Project 2: SPA Full Stack Web App (React)

links.title: Link to project github repository for the frontend code
Link to project github repository for the backend code

projects.description: This is a full stack web application using React for the client side. The movie application provides a list of movies with details including the description, directors, and actors. A user can create a profile and add movies to their favorites and a to watch list.
projects.stack: This app uses the MERN (MongoDB, Express, React, and Node. js) stack
role: Frontend interface to display the movies (and movie details) and user profile setup and managements
Backend server with the database and the API to access the database
learnings: Create a REST API with proper user documentation
Design a Single Page Application using React

images.alt: Screenshot of myFlix Create Account Page
Screenshot of myFlix User Profile Page
Screenshot of myFlix Movies List Page
Screenshot of myFlix Movie Details Page

projects.title: Project 3: PWA Web App
projects.description: Goal was to build a serverless, progressive web application (PWA) with React using a test-driven development (TDD) technique. The application uses the Google Calendar API to fetch upcoming events.
loginData: Requires Google Account for OAuth login
projects.stack: This app uses React, Rechart, AWS Lambda, OAuth, Google Cloud, Google Calendar API. The testing uses React Testing Library, Jest, Jest-Cucumber, and Puppeteer
role: Set up the serverless function using AWS Lambda and hosted on AWS
Set up the Authorization Server using Google OAuth to provide the access tokens needed to access to the Google Calendar API

Build a progressive web app using React to that allowed users to filter by city, show/hide event details, specify the number of events to display, use the app offline,  add a home screen shortcut, and display charts visualizing event details
learnings: Set up a serverless functions using AWS Lambda
Design a Progressive Web Application using React
Create unit, integration, and end-to-end testing

images.alt: Screenshot of CliqueUp Main Page showing charts of event statistics
Screenshot of CliqueUp Main Page showing list of upcoming events

projects.title: Project 4: React Native App
projects.description: This is a mobile chat application built with React Native. It provides users with a chat interface and options to share images and their location.
loginData: No login required, however the repository must be cloned, installed, and then run on an emulator or device.See the README for instructions.
projects.stack: This app uses React, Node, JavaScript, React Native, Expo, Google Firestore, Google Firebase, and Gifted Chat
role: Build a React Native App using JavaScript
Build the chat UI with Accessibly
learnings: Use device's location, microphone, and camera
Use an emulator for mobile testing

images.alt: Screenshot of Chatly's Main Page showing Name input and background color selection
Screenshot of Chatly's  Action Options in the Chat Screen

projects.title: Project 5: SPA Full-Stack Web App (Angular)

links.title: Link to project github repository for the frontend code
Link to project github repository for the backend code

projects.description: This is a full stack web application using Angular for the client side. This uses the backend created in Project 2. The movie application provides a list of movies with details including the description, directors, and actors. A user can create a profile and add movies to their favorites and a to watch list.
projects.stack: This app uses the MEAN (MongoDB, Express, Angular, and Node. js) stack
role: Frontend interface using Angular to display the movies (and movie details) and user profile setup and managements
Using the previously made backend server with the database and the API to access the database
learnings: Create documentation with JSDoc and TypeDoc
Design a Single Page Application using Angular
